channel.title: Help running a batch file using java

item.title: Help running a batch file using java
item.dc:creator: @RXVL RXVL
item.description:
@RXVL wrote:

I’m editing my antilag.java file so that every 30 minutes it runs a batch file. Heres the code that I have so far:

[code]import java.io.*;

public class antilag
{

public int ResetTimer = 0;

public void resetserver()
{
misc.println(“REBOOTING SERVER!!!”);
misc.println(“Saving all games…”);
PlayerHandler.kickAllPlayers = true;
misc.println(“GAME SUCCESSFULLY SAVED FOR ALL PLAYERS”);
ResetTimer = 0;
killserv();
}
public void process()
{
ResetTimer += 1;
if(ResetTimer >= 10)
{
resetserver();
}
}

public void killserv()
{
String run = “restart.bat”;
}
}[/code]

It compiles correctly yet it doesn’t run. I changed the timer to 10 seconds to quickly test it and it sends all the commands I want it just doesnt run the batch file. If running the batch doesnt work does anyone know how to run a .exe file using java?[br][size=1]Posted at: November 12, 2006, 09:05:10 AM[/size][hr]Ummmmm

Read full topic
item.source: Help running a batch file using java
